<ce:section-title>Synthesis of complexes</ce:section-title><ce:section-title>Synthesis of [Ag<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>(μ-4,4′-bpp)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>(1,3-bdc)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]<ce:inf loc="post">
<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>
</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>2nH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">Ligand compound 4,4′-bpp was prepared by 2,2′-biphenol and 4-picolyl chloride hydrochloride . The solution of AgNO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (0.017<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), NaOH (0.008<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and 1,3-H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>bdc (0.017<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) was carefully covered by buffer layer (MeOH:H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>1:1). Then, the solution of 4,4′-bpp (0.036<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in MeOH (5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) was slowly added above the buffer layer. The light yellow block crystals produced at the buffer layer after a few weeks. Yield: 0.036<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g (75%). Elementary <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">44</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">36</ce:inf>Ag<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf> (948.48): C, 55.60; H, 3.82; N, 4.42. Found: C, 55.52; H, 3.88; N, 4.36%. IR (KBr, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3435 (vw), 1602 (s), 1563 (w), 1502 (s), 1461 (s), 1428 (s), 1384 (m), 1351 (m), 1236 (s), 1115 (s), 1053 (m), 1029 (s), 806 (w), 748 (s), 489 (vw).</ce:para><ce:section-title>Synthesis of [Ag(μ-4,4′-bpp)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>ClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>]<ce:inf loc="post">
<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>
</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">The buffer layer prepared by mixing MeOH and water (the ratio is 1:1) was carefully covered on the solution AgClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf> (0.027<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL). Then, the solution of 4,4′-bpp (0.036<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in MeOH (5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) was slowly added above the buffer layer. Over a period of four weeks, the light yellow block crystals formed at the buffer layer. Yield: 0.039<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g (83%). Elementary <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">48</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">40</ce:inf>AgClN<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf> (944.19): C, 61.06; H, 4.27; N, 5.93. Found: C, 61.15; H, 4.31; N, 5.91%. IR (KBr, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3066 (w), 2918 (w), 1596 (m), 1508 (m), 1481 (s), 1455 (m), 1287 (w), 1249 (s), 1234 (m), 1161 (m), 1108 (w), 1059 (m), 1032 (s), 928 (w), 752 (s), 636 (w), 622 (w).</ce:para>
clean_text:
Synthesis of complexes

Synthesis of [Ag4(μ-4,4'-bpp)3(1,3-bdc)2] n  ⋅2nH2O (1)

Ligand compound 4,4'-bpp was prepared by 2,2'-biphenol and 4-picolyl chloride hydrochloride . The solution of AgNO3 (0.017g, 0.10mmol), NaOH (0.008g, 0.20mmol) and 1,3-H2bdc (0.017g, 0.10mmol) in H2O (5mL) was carefully covered by buffer layer (MeOH:H2O=1:1). Then, the solution of 4,4'-bpp (0.036g, 0.10mmol) in MeOH (5mL) was slowly added above the buffer layer. The light yellow block crystals produced at the buffer layer after a few weeks. Yield: 0.036g (75%). Elementary Anal. Calc. for C44H36Ag2N3O8 (948.48): C, 55.60; H, 3.82; N, 4.42. Found: C, 55.52; H, 3.88; N, 4.36%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3435 (vw), 1602 (s), 1563 (w), 1502 (s), 1461 (s), 1428 (s), 1384 (m), 1351 (m), 1236 (s), 1115 (s), 1053 (m), 1029 (s), 806 (w), 748 (s), 489 (vw).

Synthesis of [Ag(μ-4,4'-bpp)2ClO4] n  (2)

The buffer layer prepared by mixing MeOH and water (the ratio is 1:1) was carefully covered on the solution AgClO4 (0.027g, 0.10mmol) in H2O (5mL). Then, the solution of 4,4'-bpp (0.036g, 0.10mmol) in MeOH (5mL) was slowly added above the buffer layer. Over a period of four weeks, the light yellow block crystals formed at the buffer layer. Yield: 0.039g (83%). Elementary Anal. Calc. for C48H40AgClN4O8 (944.19): C, 61.06; H, 4.27; N, 5.93. Found: C, 61.15; H, 4.31; N, 5.91%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3066 (w), 2918 (w), 1596 (m), 1508 (m), 1481 (s), 1455 (m), 1287 (w), 1249 (s), 1234 (m), 1161 (m), 1108 (w), 1059 (m), 1032 (s), 928 (w), 752 (s), 636 (w), 622 (w).
